This Jobot Job is hosted by Tim Sargious

Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Easy Apply" button and sending us your resume.

Salary $75,000 - $80,000 per year

A Bit About Us

Since 1918, the relationships we’ve developed and maintained have helped us to become a leading independent regional certified public accounting and consulting firm and a Top 200 CPA firm in the United States. We serve clients in California, Oregon, Washington, Idaho, Arizona, New Mexico and throughout the United States. Our Company provides accounting, audit, tax, consulting, and asset accumulation and preservation services to dairies, farmers, businesses, organizations, and individuals (U.S. and foreign-based), doing business domestically and internationally.

We’ve built a team of highly qualified CPAs and management consultants who share one goal—to achieve outstanding results for you.



Why join us?


Competitive SalaryGreat Benefits (Medical, Dental and Vision) 100% covered by the employer401k Match Generous paid time offTrainingCareer AdvancementFun, energetic working environment

Job Details

Job Details

Our company is seeking a detail-oriented, experienced Staff Accountant/Auditor to join our dynamic finance team. This is a permanent position that offers the opportunity to work in a fast-paced, high-volume environment where you will play a crucial role in maintaining and improving our financial health. As a Staff Accountant/Auditor, you will be responsible for preparing financial reports, performing account reconciliations, maintaining the general ledger, preparing tax returns, assisting with audit preparations, and performing other accounting duties as assigned. This role is ideal for a finance professional who thrives in a challenging and rewarding environment and is eager to make a significant impact on our company's financial operations.

Responsibilities

 Prepare financial statements and reports to ensure accurate and timely financial reporting. Conduct monthly and quarterly account reconciliations to ensure accurate reporting and ledger maintenance. Assist in the preparation of annual budgets and forecasts. Coordinate with the tax department to ensure accurate and timely tax return preparation. Assist with audit preparations and respond to auditor requests for support documentation. Analyze financial reports for discrepancies and other issues that should be brought to the CFO's attention. Review and recommend modifications to accounting systems and procedures. Develop and document business processes to maintain and strengthen internal controls. Participate in financial standards setting and in the forecast process.

Qualifications

 Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field. A minimum of 2 years of experience in accounting or a related field. CPA or CMA certification is preferred. Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, with advanced knowledge of Excel. Experience with accounting software, such as QuickBooks or Sage. Strong understanding of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP). Excellent analytical skills with an attention to detail. Strong problem-solving skills with a hands-on approach. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Proven ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously and meet deadlines. Strong ethics, with an ability to manage confidential data. Demonstrated ability to improve processes and increase efficiency.

Join our team and contribute to our mission while advancing your career in finance. We offer a competitive salary and benefits package, and a supportive and inclusive work environment. We are committed to professional development and offer opportunities for advancement. If you're a dedicated, ambitious professional who is eager to make a difference, we want to hear from you.

Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Easy Apply" button.
